title: Red Oak Lumber
description: 46bf 1/2" Red Oak @ 3.39

title: 2x Vertical Panels
description: Cut boards to length, joint the edges, domino the edges, and glue boards together.

title: 2x Horizontal Panels
description: Cut boards to length, joint the edges, domino the edges, and glue boards together.

title: 2x Roof Panels
description: Cut boards to length, joint the edges, domino the edges, and glue boards together.

title: Finish Test
description: Cut & prep samples, then test 'Natural' & 'Smoke' Part A.

title: Partial Back & Shelf Panels
description: Cut boards to length and joint the edges.

title: Remaining Back & Shelf Panels
description: Domino the edges, and glue boards together.

title: Square up panels
description: Use a jointer plane to flatten one edge per panel, then reference off that edge to cut the ends perpendicular to it.

title: Select and label panels
description: Using the cutlist, map actual panels to assembly parts to optimize utilization and appearance.

title: Final Case Panel Dimensioning
description: Size and sand the case panels + cut all other panels oversized.

title: Begin Marking Case Panel Joinery
description: Using relative dimensions wherever possible, carefully mark Domino reference lines.

title: Finish Marking Case Panel Joinery
description: Using relative dimensions wherever possible, carefully mark Domino reference lines.

title: Cut thin side piece
description: Cut the thin side piece out of a suitable rough piece and do a first sanding pass

title: Cut dominos
description: Finalize domino locations, then cut them all out and dry assemble to confirm fit.

title: Hybrid back panel
description: Using dominos, glue up the back bin panel hardwood edge to the MDF piece.

title: Hybrid panel flushing
description: Plane down the hardwood part of the hybrid panel so it sits flush with the MDF.

title: Shelf flattening
description: Use a handplane to flatten the four shelves, then sand to 120.

title: Shelf Domino markings
description: Measuring from the top of the panels, mark the domino reference line 2mm above the final shelf position.

title: Finalize RHS shelf dimensions.
description: Carefully cut down RHS shelf panels to idnetical final dimension.

title: Cut display strips.
description: Rip strips of the right width then make sure they are equal and parallel with a handplane.

title: Cut shelf domino reference stick.
description: Rip a strip and make sure sides are parallel. Mark domino locations at regular intervals across the width

title: Shelf Joinery.
description: Mark and cut shelf dominos on side, middle, and shelf pieces using a story stick.

title: Bin Shelves.
description: Dry assemble case and take final measurements for bin shelf/back sizes then cut shelves to size.

title: Back Panel Sizing
description: Cut back panels to final width using shelves as story sticks.

title: Shelf Domino Marks
description: Create story stick for back panel dominos + mark domino locations on shelves and reference line on vertical panels.

title: Finish Stain Test #2
description: Sand and apply 'Citrine', 'Pine', and 'Touch of Gold' finish samples to test pieces.

title: Shelf Back Dominos
description: Using a story stick, mark then cut the domino mortises in the back of all the shelves and the MDF panels.

title: Finish Testing
description: Sand down a sample board and test different combinations of finishes and paints.

title: Book Shelves Joinery
description: Measure and cut domino mortises for the book shelf parts & their connecting pieces.

title: Back Panel Joinery
description: Mark out domino locations and cut mortises in display back, middle, and LHS support.

title: Test Fit
description: Cut out remaining dominos and do a dry assembly of the parts, adjusting dominos as needed

title: Final Touches
description: Cut out first shelf notch & cut domino mortises. Measure and cut out bar holes. Cut missing/incorrect domino mortises from dry fit.

title: Domino Tenon Glueing
description: Glue the domino tenons into all the tight mortises.

title: Shelf Glue up + Finishing prep
description: Glue the two shelf components together for both shelves. Start final sanding and adding tape to glue surfaces before paint.

title: Finishing Prep
description: Sand the glued shelf pieces flush. Continue sanding and taping over joinery for painted parts.

title: Roof Parts
description: Cut roof pieces to correct width then sand to 120 grit. Cut 45deg angle on top piece and use hand plane to get it down to 35deg. Using top dimension, cut MDF back triangle.

title: Roof Miter
description: Dial in the angle, then cut the roof miter to 35deg. Make sure to save the triangular off-cuts for the attic corners.

title: Roof Joinery
description: Cut Domino mortises in roof miter, attic back piece, roof pieces, and top shelf. Glue dominos in back piece.

title: Prep Top & Bottom
description: Sand top and bottom pieces to 120 grit then add masking tape to joinery.

title: Roof Sizing
description: Cut straight end of the roof to the correct dimension using the back as reference.

title: Roof Finishing
description: Round external roof corners and add light roundover on the lip. Sand smooth and tape miter.

title: Oil Parts
description: Prepare oil finish and apply to all pieces that won't be painted.

title: Paint
description: Prepare paint, clean dust of parts and paint first coat. Lightly (220 grit) sand first coat, remove dust and apply second coat.

title: Oil Fail
description: Test oil on sample piece, then on painted parts. Sand off oil from painted parts.

title: Paint 3rd coat
description: Prepare more paint, then apply a 3rd coat. Carefully tip the brush and follow the direction of the grain to give each piece an even finish.

title: Paint Scuff
description: Brush the panels to remove dirt, then using a piece of cardboard gently smooth all the pieces to an even & smooth surface.

title: Paint Oil
description: Sand the unpainted surfaces of the painted panels to remove stray paint. Add Rubio to all painted surfaces

title: Installation bits & bobs
description: Furniture straps + flexible shims + felt strips

title: Paint Oil Second Coat
description: Add 2nd coat of Rubio to all painted surfaces

title: Wax
description: Wipe on the wax with a non-abrasive white pad, then buff it off with a paper towel.

title: Glue Prep
description: Start removing the tape from the panels + sanding the paint/finish off the dominos and edges.

title: More Glue Prep
description: Continue removing the tape from the panels + sanding the paint/finish off the dominos and edges.

title: Final Glue Prep + Glue
description: Finish removing the tape from the panels + sanding the paint/finish off the dominos and edges. Glue the first shelf into the back

title: Final Assembly
description: Every 4-8h, glue panels together joint-by-joint using minimal glue and making sure everything is square and flush.

title: Final Assembly
description: Every 4-8h, glue panels together joint-by-joint using minimal glue and making sure everything is square and flush.

title: Final Assembly
description: Every 4-8h, glue panels together joint-by-joint using minimal glue and making sure everything is square and flush.
